dct_description_sm: California is shown as an island with a slightly rounded northern end.
Map is thought to have appeared in a dictionary of science ca. 1760.

Map consists of a single elongated sheet with seven figures, including 4 global projections and 1 double hemisphere. California appears on figures 3, 4, 5. and 7. Korea is also shown as an island, but unnamed.
dct_rights_sm: Image from the Glen McLaughlin Map Collection of California as an Island courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. If you have questions, please contact the David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu.
